items.sentence: Tom carefully cut the fabric with a pair of scissors.
Tom closed the magazine and put it into his knapsack.
Tom could tell that Mary wanted to be somewhere else.
Tom could write his name when he was three years old.
Tom and Mary are outside. They\'re playing badminton.
Tom and Mary didn\'t know that much about each other.
Excuse me, but let me have another look at the photo.
Giving advice to him is like talking to a brick wall.
He caught the first train and got there just in time.
He complained about the room being too hot and humid.
He dreaded having to spend Christmas in the hospital.
He failed the exam because he had not studied enough.
What\'re you going to do during your summer vacation?
What\'s the best way to get to the airport from here?
Tom doesn\'t know why Mary didn\'t come to the party.
Tom doesn\'t mind the cold, but Mary can\'t stand it.
When I got home, I noticed that I had lost my wallet.
When I got to the bus stop, the bus had already left.
Which one do you prefer, the red one or the blue one?
Last Sunday, Mary and I went to the library together.
Maybe this weekend we could go to the beach together.
I\'m not sure, but I think Tom wants to be a teacher.
I\'m not sure, but I think that Tom wants to do that.
I\'m not the one who told Tom not to do that anymore.
I\'m not the only one who thinks Tom should be fired.
I\'m not the same person I was when you first met me.
Tom picked up John\'s briefcase and handed it to him.
Tom said that he didn\'t have anything to write with.
What happened? There\'s water all over the apartment.
Why ask me? Wouldn\'t it be better to do it yourself?
Do you really want to know why Tom doesn\'t like you?
I don\'t think I\'m hungry enough to eat all of this.
I can\'t stop you from doing whatever you want to do.
I can\'t talk to you here. Someone might overhear us.
I can\'t think of anyone better than Tom for the job.
I can\'t think of anything more depressing than that.
I certainly didn\'t expect to see you here in Boston.
I certainly had no idea Tom didn\'t know how to swim.
The man who came to visit you didn\'t say who he was.
I don\'t think that we\'ll get home until after dark.
I don\'t think we\'ll ever know what happened to Tom.
I don\'t understand why you and Tom don\'t get along.
I don\'t want to think about what could\'ve happened.
Tom said he didn\'t have to worry about Mary anymore.
Tom said he didn\'t know what Mary wanted him to buy.
Tom said he didn\'t know when Mary would be arriving.
Tom said he didn\'t know where he was supposed to go.
Tom said he didn\'t see anything out of the ordinary.
Tom said he didn\'t think Mary was really a Canadian.
In America, cars drive on the right side of the road.
